body:
![build](https://github.com/cosmo-lang/cosmo/actions/workflows/crystal.yml/badge.svg) # Cosmo Cosmo is a statically-typed interpreted programming language written in pure Crystal.
We have an [extension for VS code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=cosmo.vscode-cosmo) ([source](https://github.com/R-unic/vscode-cosmo)), however it currently only features syntax highlighting and code snippets. ## Installation Download the [Cosmo Installer](https://github.com/cosmo-lang/cosmo-installer/releases) and run it. ## Contributing There is a guide about how to contribute [here](https://github.com/cosmo-lang/cosmo/wiki) on our Wiki. 1. [Fork it](https://github.com/R-unic/cosmo/fork) 2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`) 3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`) 4. Test your code (`make test`) 5. Push to the branch (`make publish`) 6. Create a new [Pull Request](https://github.com/cosmo-lang/cosmo/pulls) Have any questions or comments? DM me on Discord: `runic#5997` ## Contributors - [R-unic](https://github.com/R-unic) - creator and maintainer - [quasar098](https://github.com/quasar098) - [Kevin Alavik](https://github.com/kevinalavik) ## Things I Might Do - Named arguments - Make a Cosmo->C compiler - C bindings ## Things I Gotta Do ### Features - Grammar - Regexes - Endless (and beginless?) range literals - Postfix `every` loop (e.x. `x < 1 for every int x in vec`)? - `typeof` - Multiple assignment/declaration with spreads (e.x. `int x, y = *[1, 2]`) - `:=` operator (this will include making `=` binary expressions a statement [this is gonna be weird to implement lmao]) - Enums - Decorators - Interfaces - Namespaces - Classes * single inheritance * mixins * static/protected members - Rewrite type system * bound expressions (!!) * an actual type pass * generics * type inference * casting union types * implicit conversions * intersection types - Other - Extend `HTTP` library * routing stuff - `+` operator for vectors, same functionality as `Vector->combine` - `string` and `char` to hex conversions (e.x. `'f' == 15`) - Some form of multithreading - Intrinsic methods for all datatypes (inherit from a base type) - REPL supports multiline source - Colorize REPL input ### Fixes - Performance boosts lol - Access imported aliased types - Access types within tables (e.x.`JSON::Any`) - More detailed errors when unable to resolve a type - Import stack traces - Properly log errors from intrinsics - Segfaults * passing `$`? (pretty sure this is just like everything to do with classes) * `[1,2,3]` - Class instance variables available outside of `$` - Throw if same module was imported twice - `["a.b.c"].first.split('.')` tries to access `["a.b.c"].first` instead of `["a.b.c"].first()` because of the `split` call with parentheses (bug) ### Tests - Chained method calls with optional parentheses (e.x. `["a.b.c"].first.split('.').first == "a"`) - Expectation of errors in parser spec (e.x. `()` throws `Invalid syntax ')': Expected an expression`) - New intrinsic libraries ### Refactorings (empty) ### Meta - Package manager ([Stars](https://github.com/cosmo-lang/stars) + [StarsAPI](https://github.com/cosmo-lang/stars-api)) (WIP) - Documentation generator? - Language server - Highlight function definition names without parentheses ### Docs (empty)

instance_methods.name: read_file
instance_methods.doc: Reads a file at `path` and returns it's contents
instance_methods.summary: Reads a file at path and returns it's contents

def.name: read_file
def.body:
begin
  contents = File.read(path)
  read_source(contents, file_path: path)
rescue ex : Exception
  abort("Failed to read file \"#{path}\": \n#{ex.message}\n\t#{ex.backtrace.join("\n\t")}", 1)
end

def.name: read_source
def.body:
begin
  @@interpreter.interpret(source, file_path)
rescue ex : Exception
  bug = !Logger.debug?
  msg = (bug ? "BUG: " : "") + "#{ex.inspect_with_backtrace}"
  if bug
    msg = msg + "\nYou've found a bug! Please open an issue, including source code so we can reproduce the bug: https://github.com/cosmo-lang/cosmo/issues"
  end
  abort(msg, 1)
end

instance_methods.name: run_repl
instance_methods.doc: Starts the REPL
instance_methods.summary: Starts the REPL

def.name: run_repl
def.body:
puts("Welcome to the #{rainbow("Cosmo")} REPL!")
loop do
  STDOUT.write((Util::Color.light_green("Â» ")).to_slice)
  line = STDIN.gets
  if line.nil? || line.chomp.empty?
    break
  end
  result = read_source(line, file_path: "repl")
end

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (object : Cosmo::AST::Expression::Base, key : Cosmo::Token, nullable : Bool = false)

def.name: full_path
def.body:
path = ""
if @object.is_a?(Access)
  path = path + (@object.as(Access)).full_path
else
  path = path + (@object.token.lexeme + PROP_ACCESS)
end
path = (path.rchop(PROP_ACCESS)) + "->"
path = path + @key.lexeme

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(value, object, inversed, keyword)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end

def.name: to_s
def.body:
s = "Literal<{\n"
@hashmap.keys.each do |k|
  s = s + (TAB * (indent + 1))
  s = s + (k.to_s(indent + 1))
  s = s + " -> "
  s = s + (@hashmap[k].to_s(indent + 1))
  s = s + "\n"
end
s + "#{TAB * indent}}>"

instance_methods.name: single_expression
instance_methods.doc:
It yields itself for any node, but if it's a
`Statement::ExpressionList`, then it returns the
first node of the `ExpressionList` statement
instance_methods.summary: It yields itself for any node, but if it's a Statement::ExpressionList, then it returns the first node of the ExpressionList statement

instance_methods.name: single_expression?
instance_methods.doc:
It yields `nil` always for any regular node.
(It is overridden by `ExpressionList` to implement `#single_expression`.)
instance_methods.summary: It yields nil always for any regular node.

instance_methods.name: single_expression?
instance_methods.doc: It yields first node if this holds only one node, or yields `nil`.
instance_methods.summary: It yields first node if this holds only one node, or yields nil.

def.name: single_expression?
def.body:
if @nodes.size == 1
  expr = @nodes.first.single_expression
  if expr.is_a?(Statement::SingleExpression)
    expr.expression
  else
    expr.as(Expression::Base)
  end
else
  nil
end

instance_methods.name: define_field
instance_methods.args_string: (field_name : String, value : ValueType, token : Token | Nil, mutable = false, visibility : Visibility = Visibility::Private, typedef : Token | Nil = nil, not_redefining = false) : ValueType
instance_methods.args_html: (field_name : String, value : ValueType, token : Token | Nil, mutable = false, visibility : Visibility = Visibility::Private, typedef : Token | Nil = nil, not_redefining = false) : ValueType

def.name: define_field
def.body:
current_meta = @field_meta[field_name]?
if current_meta.nil?
else
  if current_meta[:"mutable?"] || @constructing
  else
    Logger.report_error("Attempt to assign to an immutable property", field_name, token.not_nil!)
  end
end
if @field_meta[field_name]?.nil?
  meta_hash = {} of Symbol => Token | Bool
  meta_hash[:"mutable?"] = mutable
  if typedef.nil?
    if current_meta.nil?
    else
      typedef = current_meta[:type]
      TypeChecker.assert(typedef.lexeme + "|void", value, typedef)
    end
  else
    meta_hash[:type] = typedef
    @field_meta[field_name] = FieldMeta.from(meta_hash)
  end
end
if not_redefining
  registry = @public["fields"].has_key?(field_name) ? @public : (  @protected["fields"].has_key?(field_name) ? @protected : @private)
else
  registry = visibility == Visibility::Public ? @public : (  visibility == Visibility::Protected ? @protected : @private)
end
(registry["fields"].as(Hash(String, ValueType)))[field_name] = value
value

def.name: define_method
def.body:
registry = visibility == Visibility::Public ? @public : (visibility == Visibility::Protected ? @protected : @private)
if (!token.nil?) && (registry["methods"].has_key?(method_name))
  Logger.report_error("Duplicate method definition in '#{name}'", method_name, token)
end
registry["methods"][method_name] = value
value

def.name: get_field
def.body:
field : ValueType | ::Nil = @public["fields"][field_name]?
meta : FieldMeta | ::Nil = @field_meta[field_name]?
if (meta.nil? && (!token.nil?)) && required
  Logger.report_error("Field '#{field_name}' does not exist on", name, token)
end
if include_private
  field || (field = @private["fields"][field_name]?)
end
if include_protected
  field || (field = @protected["fields"][field_name]?)
end
if ((!token.nil?) && (!include_private)) && (@private["fields"].has_key?(field_name))
  Logger.report_error("Attempt to access private field", field_name, token)
end
field.as(ValueType)

instance_methods.args_string: (method_name : String, token : Token | Nil = nil, include_private = true, include_protected = false, required = true) : Function | Nil

def.name: get_method
def.body:
method : Function | ::Nil = @public["methods"][method_name]?.as(Function | ::Nil)
if include_private
  method || (method = @private["methods"][method_name]?.as(Function | ::Nil))
end
if include_protected
  method || (method = @protected["methods"][method_name]?.as(Function | ::Nil))
end
if (token.nil? || include_private) || @private["methods"][method_name]?.nil?
else
  Logger.report_error("Attempt to access private method", method_name, token)
end
if (token.nil? || include_protected) || @protected["methods"][method_name]?.nil?
else
  Logger.report_error("Attempt to access protected method outside of class definition", method_name, token)
end
if (method.nil? && (!token.nil?)) && required
  Logger.report_error("Method '#{method_name}' does not exist on", name, token)
end
method

def.name: arity
def.body:
params = @definition.is_a?(Statement::FunctionDef) ? (@definition.as(Statement::FunctionDef)).parameters : (@definition.as(Expression::Lambda)).parameters
start = @non_nullable_params.size
if params.select(&.spread?).empty?
  finish = params.size
else
  finish = MAX_FN_PARAMS
end

instance_methods.name: call
instance_methods.doc: Executes the function body, passing in `args`
instance_methods.summary: Executes the function body, passing in args
instance_methods.args_string: (args : Array(ValueType), return_type_override : String = return_typedef.lexeme, class_instance_override : ClassInstance | Nil = @class_instance) : ValueType
instance_methods.args_html: (args : Array(ValueType), return_type_override : String = return_typedef.lexeme, class_instance_override : ClassInstance | Nil = @class_instance) : ValueType

def.name: call
def.body:
enclosing_return_type = @interpreter.meta["block_return_type"]?
@interpreter.set_meta("block_return_type", return_type_override)
scope = Scope.new(@closure)
enclosing_within_fn = @interpreter.within_fn
@interpreter.within_fn = true
@interpreter.start_recursion(@definition.token)
if class_instance_override.nil?
else
  enclosing_this = @interpreter.meta["this"]?
  @interpreter.set_meta("this", class_instance_override)
  scope.declare(@interpreter.fake_typedef(class_instance_override.not_nil!.name), @interpreter.fake_ident("$"), class_instance_override, mutable: true)
end
params = @definition.is_a?(Statement::FunctionDef) ? (@definition.as(Statement::FunctionDef)).parameters : (@definition.as(Expression::Lambda)).parameters
params.each_with_index do |param, i|
  default_value = param.default_value.nil? ? nil : @interpreter.evaluate(param.default_value.not_nil!)
  if param.spread?
    typedef = param.typedef.dup
    typedef.lexeme = typedef.lexeme + "[]"
    scope.declare(typedef, param.identifier, expand_args(args), mutable: param.mutable?)
  else
    value = args[i]? || default_value
    if value.is_a?(Spread)
      spread_idx = 0
      value.array.each do |v|
        param = params[i + spread_idx]?
        if param.nil?
        else
          scope.declare(param.typedef, param.identifier, v, mutable: param.mutable?)
        end
        spread_idx = spread_idx + 1
      end
      break
    else
      scope.declare(param.typedef, param.identifier, value.as(ValueType), mutable: param.mutable?)
    end
  end
end
result = nil
begin
  body = @definition.is_a?(Statement::FunctionDef) ? (@definition.as(Statement::FunctionDef)).body : (@definition.as(Expression::Lambda)).body
  result = @interpreter.execute_block(body, scope, is_fn: true)
rescue returner : HookedExceptions::Return
  if return_type_override == "void"
  else
    result = returner.value
  end
rescue ex : Exception
  raise(ex)
end
if enclosing_return_type.nil?
  @interpreter.delete_meta("block_return_type")
else
  @interpreter.set_meta("block_return_type", enclosing_return_type)
end
if enclosing_this.nil?
  @interpreter.delete_meta("this")
else
  @interpreter.set_meta("this", enclosing_this)
end
@interpreter.end_recursion
@interpreter.within_fn = enclosing_within_fn
result

instance_methods.name: add_object_value
instance_methods.args_string: (token : Token, object : V, key : ValueType, value : ValueType) : V forall V
instance_methods.args_html: (token : Token, object : V, key : ValueType, value : ValueType) : V forall V

def.name: add_object_value
def.body:
if object.is_a?(Array)
  if key.is_a?(Int)
  else
    Logger.report_error("Invalid index type", TypeChecker.get_mapped(key.class), token)
  end
  if object[key]?.nil?
    object.insert(key, value)
  else
    object[key] = value
  end
else
  if object.is_a?(Hash)
    object[key] = value
  else
    if object.is_a?(ClassInstance)
      if key.is_a?(String)
      else
        Logger.report_error("Invalid index type", TypeChecker.get_mapped(key.class), token)
      end
      object.define_field(key, value, token, not_redefining: true)
    else
      Logger.report_error("Attempt to assign to index of", TypeChecker.get_mapped(object.class), token)
    end
  end
end
object

instance_methods.name: call_meta_method
instance_methods.args_string: (instance : ClassInstance, operand : ValueType, name : String, op_lexeme : String, op_token : Token, return_type_override : String | Nil = nil) : ValueType
instance_methods.args_html: (instance : ClassInstance, operand : ValueType, name : String, op_lexeme : String, op_token : Token, return_type_override : String | Nil = nil) : ValueType

def.name: call_meta_method
def.body:
meta_method = instance.get_method(name, include_private: false)
if meta_method.nil?
  Logger.report_error("'#{op_lexeme}' operator meta method is not defined for", instance.name, op_token)
else
  if (name != "is_in$") || (meta_method.return_typedef.lexeme == return_type_override)
  else
    Logger.report_error("Invalid 'is_in$' return type", "'is_in$' meta method must return 'bool', got #{meta_method.return_typedef.lexeme}", meta_method.return_typedef)
  end
  return meta_method.call([operand])
end

instance_methods.name: declare_intrinsic
instance_methods.args_string: (type : String, ident : String, value : ValueType, visibility = Visibility::Public) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (type : String, ident : String, value : ValueType, visibility = Visibility::Public) : Nil

def.name: declare_intrinsic
def.body:
location = Location.new("intrinsic", 0, 0)
ident_token = fake_ident(ident, location)
typedef_token = fake_typedef(type, location)
@scope.declare(typedef_token, ident_token, value, mutable: true, visibility: visibility)

instance_methods.name: execute_block
instance_methods.args_string: (block : Statement::Base, block_scope : Scope, is_fn : Bool = false) : ValueType

def.name: execute_block
def.body:
enclosing = @scope
begin
  @scope = block_scope
  if @meta["this"]?.nil? || (!@scope.lookup?("$").nil?)
  else
    this = @meta["this"].as(ClassInstance)
    @scope.declare(fake_typedef(this.name), fake_ident("$"), this, mutable: true)
  end
  if block.is_a?(Statement::Block)
    if block.empty?
      return nil
    end
    if block.nodes.empty?
    else
      return_node = block.nodes.find do |node|
        node.is_a?(Statement::Return)
      end || block.nodes.last
      body_nodes = block.nodes[0..-2]
      body_nodes.each do |stmt|
        execute(stmt)
      end
      if return_node.nil?
      else
        return_value = execute(return_node)
      end
    end
    if is_fn
      return_type = @meta["block_return_type"]
      token = return_node.nil? ? block.token : return_node.token
      if return_type.to_s == "void"
      else
        TypeChecker.assert(return_type.to_s, return_value, token)
      end
    end
  else
    return_value = execute(block)
  end
  if return_type.to_s == "void"
  else
    return return_value
  end
  nil
rescue ex : Exception
  raise(ex)
ensure
  @scope = enclosing
end

instance_methods.name: execute_main
instance_methods.doc: Check if a "main" fn exists and call it
instance_methods.summary: Check if a "main" fn exists and call it

def.name: execute_main
def.body:
main_fn = @globals.lookup?("main")
is_public = @globals.public?("main")
found_main = (!main_fn.nil?) && main_fn.is_a?(Function)
if found_main
  if is_public
    main_fn = main_fn.as(Function)
    return_typedef = main_fn.return_typedef
    if TypeChecker.is?(return_typedef.lexeme, 1, return_typedef)
    else
      Logger.report_error("Invalid main() function", "A main() function may only return 'int'", return_typedef)
    end
    main_result = main_fn.call([ARGV.map() do |__arg0|
      __arg0.as(ValueType)
    end])
    if main_result.nil?
      Logger.report_error("Invalid main() function", "Your main() function did not return an 'int'", return_typedef)
    end
    TypeChecker.assert("int", main_result, return_typedef)
    main_result.as(Int64)
  else
    puts("[WARNING]: Found main() function, but it is not public. It will not be called on program execution.")
  end
end

def.name: interpret
def.body:
@file_path = file_path
is_intrinsic_lib = @file_path.ends_with?(GLOBAL_INTRINSIC_FILE)
if is_intrinsic_lib
else
  Logger.register_source(@file_path, source)
end
parser = Parser.new(source, @file_path, @run_benchmarks)
statements = parser.parse
statement_list_str = ""
statements.each do |stmt|
  statement_list_str = statement_list_str + (stmt.to_s + "\n")
end
if @output_ast
  puts(statement_list_str)
end
resolver = Resolver.new(self)
resolver.resolve(statements)
end_time = Time.monotonic
if @run_benchmarks
  puts("Resolver @#{@file_path} took #{Util.get_elapsed(resolver.start_time, end_time)}.")
end
start_time = Time.monotonic
result = nil
statements.each do |stmt|
  result = execute(stmt)
  if (file_path == "repl") && (stmt.is_a?(Statement::SingleExpression) || (!result.nil?))
    puts("=> " + (Util::Stringify.any_value(result)))
  end
end
main_result = execute_main
end_time = Time.monotonic
if @run_benchmarks
  puts("Interpreter @#{file_path} took #{Util.get_elapsed(start_time, end_time)}.")
end
if ((!main_result.nil?) && (@file_path != "test")) && (@file_path != "repl")
  code = main_result.not_nil!
  if code == 0
    Process.exit(code)
  else
    abort("Process exited with code #{code}", 1)
  end
end
result

def.name: start_recursion
def.body:
@recursion_depth = @recursion_depth + 1
if @recursion_depth >= @max_recursion_depth
  Logger.report_error("Stack overflow", "Recursion depth of #{@max_recursion_depth} exceeded", token)
end

def.name: visit_access_expr
def.body:
object = evaluate(expr.object)
if object.nil? && expr.nullable?
  return nil
end
key = expr.key.lexeme
if object.is_a?(Hash)
  value = object[key]?
  if value.nil?
    fn = (Intrinsic::Table.new(self, object)).get_method(expr.key, required: false)
    if fn.nil?
    else
      return (fn.arity.begin == 0) && (!@evaluating_fn_callee) ? fn.call([] of ValueType) : fn
    end
    if object.has_key?(key)
    else
      Logger.report_error("Invalid table key", "'#{key}'", expr.key)
    end
  else
    if (value.is_a?(Callable) && (value.arity.begin == 0)) && (!@evaluating_fn_callee)
      value.call([] of ValueType)
    else
      value
    end
  end
else
  if object.is_a?(Array)
    fn = (Intrinsic::Vector.new(self, object)).get_method(expr.key)
    (fn.arity.begin == 0) && (!@evaluating_fn_callee) ? fn.call([] of ValueType) : fn
  else
    if object.is_a?(String)
      fn = (Intrinsic::Strings.new(self, object)).get_method(expr.key)
      (fn.arity.begin == 0) && (!@evaluating_fn_callee) ? fn.call([] of ValueType) : fn
    else
      if object.is_a?(Char)
        fn = (Intrinsic::Chars.new(self, object)).get_method(expr.key)
        (fn.arity.begin == 0) && (!@evaluating_fn_callee) ? fn.call([] of ValueType) : fn
      else
        if object.is_a?(Range)
          fn = (Intrinsic::Ranges.new(self, object)).get_method(expr.key)
          (fn.arity.begin == 0) && (!@evaluating_fn_callee) ? fn.call([] of ValueType) : fn
        else
          if object.is_a?(Number)
            fn = (Intrinsic::Numbers.new(self, object)).get_method(expr.key)
            if (fn.arity.begin == 0) && (!@evaluating_fn_callee)
            else
              return fn
            end
            begin
              fn.call([] of ValueType)
            rescue ex : OverflowError
              Logger.report_error("Arithmetic overflow", "Number exceeded its bounds", expr.token)
            end
          else
            if object.is_a?(ClassInstance)
              value = object.get_member(key, expr.key, include_private: @meta.has_key?("this"), field_required: key != "to_string")
              if (value.is_a?(Callable) && (value.arity.begin == 0)) && (!@evaluating_fn_callee)
                value.call([] of ValueType)
              else
                key == "to_string" ? object.name : value
              end
            else
              Logger.report_error("Attempt to index", "#{TypeChecker.get_mapped(object.class)} at '#{expr.object.token.lexeme}'", expr.token)
            end
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

def.name: visit_binary_op_expr
def.body:
case expr.operator.type
when Syntax::Plus
  op = Operator::Plus.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Minus
  op = Operator::Minus.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Star
  op = Operator::Mul.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Slash
  op = Operator::Div.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::SlashSlash
  op = Operator::IntDiv.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Carat
  op = Operator::Pow.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Percent
  op = Operator::Mod.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::And
  (evaluate(expr.left)) && (evaluate(expr.right))
when Syntax::Or
  left = evaluate(expr.left)
  if left
    return left
  end
  evaluate(expr.right)
when Syntax::QuestionColon
  left = evaluate(expr.left)
  if left.nil?
  else
    return left
  end
  evaluate(expr.right)
when Syntax::EqualEqual
  (evaluate(expr.left)) == (evaluate(expr.right))
when Syntax::BangEqual
  (evaluate(expr.left)) != (evaluate(expr.right))
when Syntax::Less
  op = Operator::LT.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::LessEqual
  op = Operator::LTE.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Greater
  op = Operator::GT.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::GreaterEqual
  op = Operator::GTE.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Tilde
  op = Operator::Bxor.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Pipe
  op = Operator::Bor.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Ampersand
  op = Operator::Band.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::RDoubleArrow
  op = Operator::Bshr.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::LDoubleArrow
  op = Operator::Bshl.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
end

def.name: visit_case_stmt
def.body:
value = evaluate(stmt.value)
go_to_else = false
stmt.comparisons.each do |when_stmt|
  condition = true
  when_stmt.conditions.each do |condition_expr|
    if condition_expr.is_a?(Expression::TypeRef)
      condition = condition & (TypeChecker.is?(condition_expr.name.lexeme, value, when_stmt.token))
    else
      condition = condition & ((evaluate(condition_expr)) == value)
    end
  end
  if condition
    return execute(when_stmt.block)
  end
  go_to_else = true
end
if (!stmt.else.nil?) && go_to_else
  return execute(stmt.else.not_nil!)
end

instance_methods.name: visit_class_def_stmt
instance_methods.doc: abstract def visit_enum_def_stmt(stmt : EnumDef) : R
instance_methods.summary: abstract def visit_enum_def_stmt(stmt : EnumDef) : R

def.name: visit_class_def_stmt
def.body:
if @scope.lookup?(stmt.identifier.lexeme).nil?
else
  Logger.report_error("Cannot redefine class", "Class '#{stmt.identifier.lexeme}' is already defined", stmt.identifier)
end
if stmt.superclass.nil?
else
  superclass = evaluate(stmt.superclass.not_nil!)
  if superclass.is_a?(Class)
  else
    Logger.report_error("Invalid superclass", "Expected class to extend '#{stmt.identifier.lexeme}', got '#{TypeChecker.get_mapped(superclass.class)}'", stmt.superclass.not_nil!.token)
  end
end
_class = Class.new(self, @scope, stmt, superclass)
@scope.declare(fake_typedef("class"), stmt.identifier, _class, mutable: false, visibility: stmt.visibility)

def.name: visit_compound_assignment_expr
def.body:
case expr.operator.type
when Syntax::PlusEqual
  (Operator::PlusAssign.new(self)).apply(expr)
when Syntax::MinusEqual
  (Operator::MinusAssign.new(self)).apply(expr)
when Syntax::StarEqual
  (Operator::MulAssign.new(self)).apply(expr)
when Syntax::SlashEqual
  (Operator::DivAssign.new(self)).apply(expr)
when Syntax::PercentEqual
  (Operator::ModAssign.new(self)).apply(expr)
when Syntax::CaratEqual
  (Operator::PowAssign.new(self)).apply(expr)
when Syntax::AndEqual
  (Operator::AndAssign.new(self)).apply(expr)
when Syntax::OrEqual
  (Operator::OrAssign.new(self)).apply(expr)
when Syntax::QuestionColonEqual
  (Operator::CoalesceAssign.new(self)).apply(expr)
end

def.name: visit_every_stmt
def.body:
enclosing = @scope
@scope = Scope.new(@scope)
enumerable = evaluate(stmt.enumerable)
stmt.vars.each do |var|
  @scope.declare(var.typedef, var.token, nil, mutable: true)
end
@loop_level = @loop_level + 1
level : UInt32 = 0
if enumerable.is_a?(Int)
  enumerable = 0..(enumerable - 1)
end
if enumerable.is_a?(Array) || enumerable.is_a?(Range)
  enumerable.each do |value|
    assign_every_stmt_vars(stmt, value)
    start_recursion(stmt.keyword)
    level = level + 1
    begin
      execute_block(stmt.block, scope)
    rescue _break : HookedExceptions::Break
      if @loop_level == _break.loop_level
        break
      end
    rescue _next : HookedExceptions::Next
      if @loop_level == _next.loop_level
        next
      end
    end
  end
else
  if enumerable.is_a?(String)
    enumerable.chars.each do |value|
      assign_every_stmt_vars(stmt, value)
      start_recursion(stmt.keyword)
      level = level + 1
      begin
        execute_block(stmt.block, scope)
      rescue _break : HookedExceptions::Break
        if @loop_level == _break.loop_level
          break
        end
      rescue _next : HookedExceptions::Next
        if @loop_level == _next.loop_level
          next
        end
      end
    end
  else
    if enumerable.is_a?(Callable)
      if enumerable.intrinsic?
        Logger.report_error("Invalid iterator", "An iterator cannot be an intrinsic function", stmt.enumerable.token)
      end
      if enumerable.is_a?(Function)
      else
        Logger.report_error("Invalid iterator", "An iterator must return a generator function", stmt.enumerable.token)
      end
      while !(      value = enumerable.call([] of ValueType)).nil?
        assign_every_stmt_vars(stmt, value)
        start_recursion(stmt.keyword)
        level = level + 1
        begin
          execute_block(stmt.block, scope)
        rescue _break : HookedExceptions::Break
          if @loop_level == _break.loop_level
            break
          end
        rescue _next : HookedExceptions::Next
          if @loop_level == _next.loop_level
            next
          end
        end
      end
    else
      Logger.report_error("Invalid iterator type", TypeChecker.get_mapped(enumerable.class), stmt.token)
    end
  end
end
@loop_level = @loop_level - 1
end_recursion(level)
@scope = enclosing

def.name: visit_fn_call_expr
def.body:
enclosing = @evaluating_fn_callee
@evaluating_fn_callee = true
token = expr.token.dup
if expr.callee.is_a?(Expression::Access)
  token.lexeme = (expr.callee.as(Expression::Access)).full_path
end
token.lexeme = token.lexeme + "(#{expr.arguments.empty? ? "" : "..."})"
if expr.callee.is_a?(Expression::Access) || expr.callee.is_a?(Expression::Index)
  object_node = expr.callee.is_a?(Expression::Access) ? (expr.callee.as(Expression::Access)).object : (expr.callee.as(Expression::Index)).object
  object = evaluate(object_node)
  if object.is_a?(ClassInstance)
    instance_override = object
  end
end
fn = evaluate(expr.callee)
@evaluating_fn_callee = enclosing
if fn.is_a?(Callable)
else
  Logger.report_error("Attempt to call", TypeChecker.get_mapped(fn.class), expr.token)
end
arg_values = expr.arguments.map do |arg|
  evaluate(arg)
end
if (fn.arity.includes?(arg_values.size)) || (!arg_values.select() do |__arg1|
  __arg1.is_a?(Spread)
end.empty?)
else
  arg_size = fn.arity.begin == fn.arity.end ? fn.arity.begin : fn.arity
  Logger.report_error("Expected #{arg_size.to_s} arguments, got", arg_values.size.to_s, expr.token)
end
trace_idx = Logger.push_trace(token)
if fn.is_a?(Function)
  result = fn.call(arg_values, class_instance_override: instance_override)
else
  result = fn.call(fn.expand_args(arg_values))
end
Logger.pop_trace(trace_idx)
result

def.name: visit_fn_def_stmt
visit_if_stmt
def.body:
condition = evaluate(stmt.condition)
if condition
  execute(stmt.then)
else
  if stmt.else.nil?
  else
    execute(stmt.else.not_nil!)
  end
end

def.name: visit_index_expr
def.body:
object = evaluate(expr.object)
key = evaluate(expr.key)
if object.is_a?(String) || object.is_a?(Array)
  if key.is_a?(Int) || key.is_a?(Range)
  else
    Logger.report_error("Invalid index type", TypeChecker.get_mapped(key.class), expr.key.token)
  end
  value = object[key]?
  if value.nil? && (!expr.nullable?)
    Logger.report_error("Index out of bounds", "Index #{key}, array size #{object.size}", expr.key.token)
  end
  value
else
  if object.is_a?(Hash)
    value = object[key]?
    if value.nil? && (!expr.nullable?)
      Logger.report_error("Invalid table key", "'#{key}'", expr.key.token)
    end
    value
  else
    if object.is_a?(ClassInstance)
      Logger.report_error("Attempt to index class instance", expr.token.lexeme, expr.token)
    else
      Logger.report_error("Attempt to index", "#{TypeChecker.get_mapped(object.class)} at '#{expr.object.token.lexeme}'", expr.token)
    end
  end
end

def.name: visit_is_expr
def.body:
value = evaluate(expr.value)
is = TypeChecker.is?(expr.type.name.lexeme, value, expr.token)
expr.inversed? ? !is : is

def.name: visit_is_in_expr
def.body:
value = evaluate(expr.value)
object = evaluate(expr.object)
is_in = false
if object.is_a?(Array)
  is_in = object.includes?(value)
else
  if object.is_a?(Hash)
    is_in = false
    object.each_value do |v|
      if v == value
        is_in = true
        break
      end
    end
  else
    if object.is_a?(String)
      TypeChecker.assert("string|char", value, expr.value.token)
      is_in = object.includes?(value.as(String | Char))
    else
      if object.is_a?(ClassInstance)
        is_in = (call_meta_method(object, value, "is_in$", "is in", expr.keyword, "bool")).as(Bool)
      else
        Logger.report_error("Invalid 'is in' operand", "Expected vector, got '#{TypeChecker.get_mapped(value.class)}'", expr.token)
      end
    end
  end
end
expr.inversed? ? !is_in : is_in

def.name: visit_multiple_assignment_expr
def.body:
values = [] of ValueType
expr.assignments.each do |assignment|
  if assignment.is_a?(Expression::VarAssignment)
    if assignment.value.is_a?(Expression::Base)
      values << (evaluate(assignment.value.as(Expression::Base)))
    else
      values << (assignment.value.as(ValueType))
    end
  else
    if assignment.is_a?(Expression::PropertyAssignment)
      if assignment.value.is_a?(Expression::Base)
        values << (evaluate(assignment.value.as(Expression::Base)))
      else
        values << (assignment.value.as(ValueType))
      end
    end
  end
end
resolved_assignments = expr.assignments.map_with_index do |assignment, i|
  if assignment.is_a?(Expression::VarAssignment)
    assignment.value = values[i]
  else
    if assignment.is_a?(Expression::PropertyAssignment)
      assignment.value = values[i]
    end
  end
  assignment
end
resultant_values : Array(ValueType) = resolved_assignments.map do |assignment|
  evaluate(assignment)
end
resultant_values

def.name: visit_multiple_declaration_expr
def.body:
resultant_values = [] of ValueType
expr.declarations.each do |declaration|
  resultant_values << (evaluate(declaration))
end
resultant_values

def.name: visit_new_expr
def.body:
class_obj = @scope.lookup(expr.operand.token)
trace_idx = Logger.push_trace(expr.token)
args = [] of Expression::Base
if class_obj.is_a?(Class)
else
  Logger.report_error("Invalid 'new' invocation", "Expected a class name, got '#{expr.operand.token.lexeme}'", expr.operand.token)
end
if expr.operand.is_a?(Expression::FunctionCall)
  args = (expr.operand.as(Expression::FunctionCall)).arguments
end
TypeChecker.assert("class", class_obj, expr.operand.token)
arg_values = args.map do |arg|
  evaluate(arg)
end
instance = class_obj.construct(arg_values)
Logger.pop_trace(trace_idx)
instance

def.name: visit_property_assignment_expr
def.body:
if expr.object.is_a?(Expression::Index)
  index = expr.object.as(Expression::Index)
  object_node = index.object
  key = evaluate(index.key)
  object = evaluate(object_node)
else
  access = expr.object.as(Expression::Access)
  object_node = access.object
  key = access.key.lexeme
  object = evaluate(object_node)
end
value = expr.value.is_a?(Expression::Base) ? evaluate(expr.value.as(Expression::Base)) : expr.value.as(ValueType)
if object_node.is_a?(Expression::Index) || object_node.is_a?(Expression::Access)
  object = add_object_value(expr.token, object, key, value)
  prop_assignment = Expression::PropertyAssignment.new(object_node, object)
  return visit_property_assignment_expr(prop_assignment)
end
object = add_object_value(expr.token, object, key, value)
if (meta["this"]?.nil? || (expr.token.lexeme != "$")) || (!object.is_a?(ClassInstance))
  @scope.assign(expr.token, object)
else
  value
end

def.name: visit_range_literal_expr
def.body:
from = evaluate(expr.from)
to = evaluate(expr.to)
if from.is_a?(Int)
else
  Logger.report_error("Invalid left side of range literal", "Ranges can only be of integers, got '#{TypeChecker.get_mapped(from.class)}'", expr.token)
end
if to.is_a?(Int)
else
  Logger.report_error("Invalid right side of range literal", "Ranges can only be of integers, got '#{TypeChecker.get_mapped(to.class)}'", expr.token)
end
(from..to).as(RangeType)

def.name: visit_string_interpolation_expr
def.body:
expr.parts.map do |part|
  if part.is_a?(String)
    part
  else
    part_value = evaluate(part)
    part_value.nil? ? "none" : part_value.to_s
  end
end.join

def.name: visit_table_literal_expr
def.body:
hash = {} of ValueType => ValueType
expr.hashmap.each do |k, v|
  key = evaluate(k)
  value = evaluate(v)
  hash[key] = value
end
hash

def.name: visit_ternary_op_expr
def.body:
condition = evaluate(expr.condition)
if condition
  return evaluate(expr.then)
end
evaluate(expr.else)

def.name: visit_this_expr
def.body:
instance = (@scope.lookup?("$")).as(ClassInstance | ::Nil)
if instance.nil?
  Logger.report_error("Invalid '$'", expr.token.lexeme, expr.token)
end
instance

def.name: visit_throw_stmt
def.body:
err = evaluate(stmt.err)
Logger.push_trace(stmt.keyword)
if TypeChecker.is?("Exception", err, stmt.token)
else
  Logger.report_error("Invalid throw argument", "Throw statement can only be invoked with Exception, or a subclass of it. Got: #{TypeChecker.get_mapped(err.class)}", stmt.token)
end
err = err.as(ClassInstance)
level = ((err.get_field("level", stmt.keyword, include_private: true)).as(Int)).to_u
message = (err.get_field("message", stmt.keyword, include_private: true)).to_s
if @trying
  raise(HookedExceptions::Throw.new(stmt.keyword, err))
end
if @trying
else
  Logger.trace_level = level
end
Logger.report_error("Unhandled #{err.name}", message, stmt.token)

def.name: visit_try_catch_stmt
def.body:
trace_idx = Logger.push_trace(stmt.try_keyword)
enclosing = @trying
begin
  @trying = true
  execute(stmt.try_block)
rescue ex : HookedExceptions::Throw
  @scope.declare(stmt.caught_exception.typedef, stmt.caught_exception.token, ex.value)
  execute(stmt.catch_block)
ensure
  @trying = enclosing
  if stmt.finally_block.nil?
  else
    execute(stmt.finally_block.not_nil!)
  end
end
Logger.pop_trace(trace_idx)

def.name: visit_type_alias_expr
def.body:
value = evaluate(expr.value)
@scope.declare(expr.type_token, expr.token, value, expr.mutable?, expr.visibility)

def.name: visit_unary_op_expr
def.body:
operand = evaluate(expr.operand)
case expr.operator.type
when Syntax::Plus
  if operand.is_a?(ClassInstance)
    return call_meta_method(operand, nil, "unp$", expr.operator.lexeme, expr.operator)
  end
  if operand.is_a?(Float) || operand.is_a?(Int)
    operand.abs
  else
    Logger.report_error("Invalid '+' operand type", operand.class.to_s, expr.operator)
  end
when Syntax::Minus
  if operand.is_a?(ClassInstance)
    return call_meta_method(operand, nil, "unm$", expr.operator.lexeme, expr.operator)
  end
  if operand.is_a?(Float) || (operand.is_a?(Int) && (!operand.is_a?(UInt)))
    (-operand).as(ValueType)
  else
    if operand.is_a?(String)
      operand.to_s.reverse
    else
      Logger.report_error("Invalid '-' operand type", operand.class.to_s, expr.operator)
    end
  end
when Syntax::PlusPlus
  op = Operator::PlusAssign.new(self)
  op.apply(expr, "++")
when Syntax::MinusMinus
  op = Operator::MinusAssign.new(self)
  op.apply(expr, "--")
when Syntax::Not
  !operand
when Syntax::Tilde
  op = Operator::Bnot.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Star
  if operand.is_a?(ClassInstance)
    return call_meta_method(operand, nil, "splat$", expr.operator.lexeme, expr.operator)
  else
    if operand.is_a?(Array)
      Spread.new(operand)
    else
      if operand.is_a?(Spread)
        operand
      else
        Logger.report_error("Attempt to spread", TypeChecker.get_mapped(operand.class), expr.operator)
      end
    end
  end
when Syntax::Hashtag
  if operand.is_a?(ClassInstance)
    return call_meta_method(operand, nil, "size$", expr.operator.lexeme, expr.operator)
  end
  if ((operand.is_a?(Array) || operand.is_a?(Hash)) || operand.is_a?(String)) || operand.is_a?(Range)
  else
    Logger.report_error("Invalid '#' operand type", TypeChecker.get_mapped(operand.class), expr.operator)
  end
  operand.size
end

def.name: visit_unless_stmt
def.body:
condition = evaluate(stmt.condition)
if condition
  if stmt.else.nil?
  else
    execute(stmt.else.not_nil!)
  end
else
  execute(stmt.then)
end

def.name: visit_until_stmt
def.body:
@loop_level = @loop_level + 1
level : UInt32 = 0
while !(evaluate(stmt.condition))
  start_recursion(stmt.keyword)
  level = level + 1
  begin
    execute(stmt.block)
  rescue _break : HookedExceptions::Break
    if @loop_level == _break.loop_level
      break
    end
  rescue _next : HookedExceptions::Next
    if @loop_level == _next.loop_level
      next
    end
  end
end
@loop_level = @loop_level - 1
end_recursion(level)

def.name: visit_use_stmt
def.body:
relative_module_path = stmt.module_path.lexeme
imports = stmt.imports
bound_name = stmt.bound_name
if relative_module_path.includes?("/")
  if @file_path == "repl"
    Logger.report_error("Cannot import", "Local modules are not supported in the REPL", stmt.module_path)
  end
  full_module_path = File.join(File.dirname(@file_path), relative_module_path)
  ext_file_path = File.exists?(full_module_path + ".cos") ? full_module_path + ".cos" : full_module_path + ".â­"
  if full_module_path.includes?("././")
    Logger.report_error("Recursive import detected", ext_file_path.gsub("./", ""), stmt.module_path)
  end
  module_path = ext_file_path.gsub("./", "")
  if File.exists?(ext_file_path)
  else
    Logger.report_error("Cannot import", "No such file '#{(module_path.split('.', 2)).first}.cos/â­' exists", stmt.module_path)
  end
  import_file(ext_file_path, imports, bound_name)
else
  if @importable_intrinsics.has_key?(relative_module_path)
    inject_imports_of(relative_module_path, imports, bound_name) do
      @importable_intrinsics[relative_module_path].inject
    end
  else
    file_path = File.join(File.dirname("/home/runic/Dev/crystal/cosmo/src/cosmo/runtime/interpreter.cr"), "../../../libraries", relative_module_path)
    path_with_ext = file_path + (File.exists?(file_path + ".cos") ? ".cos" : ".â­")
    if File.exists?(path_with_ext)
      return import_file(path_with_ext, imports, bound_name)
    end
    pkg_path = File.join(File.dirname(@file_path), ".stars", relative_module_path)
    if File.exists?(pkg_path)
      pkg_path = File.join(pkg_path, "src", relative_module_path)
      main_file = pkg_path + (File.exists?(pkg_path + ".cos") ? ".cos" : ".â­")
      if File.exists?(main_file)
      else
        pkg_path = (pkg_path.rchop(relative_module_path)) + "main"
        main_file = pkg_path + (File.exists?(pkg_path + ".cos") ? ".cos" : ".â­")
      end
      return import_file(main_file, imports, bound_name)
    end
    Logger.report_error("Failed to resolve '#{relative_module_path}'", "Could not find package. Please run 'stars install' and try again.", stmt.module_path)
  end
end

def.name: visit_var_declaration_expr
def.body:
if (@meta.has_key?("this")) && expr.class_field?
  instance = @meta["this"].as(ClassInstance)
  instance.define_field(expr.var.token.lexeme, evaluate(expr.value), expr.token, visibility: expr.visibility, mutable: expr.mutable?, typedef: expr.typedef)
else
  @scope.declare(expr.typedef, expr.var.token, evaluate(expr.value), mutable: expr.mutable?, visibility: expr.visibility)
end

def.name: visit_var_expr
def.body:
value = @scope.lookup(expr.token)
if (value.is_a?(Callable) && (value.arity.begin == 0)) && (!@evaluating_fn_callee)
  value = value.call([] of ValueType)
end
value

def.name: get_method
def.body:
case name.lexeme.strip
when "codepoint"
  Codepoint.new(@interpreter, @value, name)
when "lower"
  Lower.new(@interpreter, @value, name)
when "upper"
  Upper.new(@interpreter, @value, name)
when "pad"
  Pad.new(@interpreter, @value, name)
when "digit?"
  Digit.new(@interpreter, @value, name)
when "letter?"
  Letter.new(@interpreter, @value, name)
when "blank?"
  Blank.new(@interpreter, @value, name)
else
  Logger.report_error("Invalid char method or property", name.lexeme, name)
end

def.name: call
def.body:
TypeChecker.assert("string", args.first, token("HTTP->fetch"))
TypeChecker.assert("Function", args[1], token("HTTP->fetch"))
TypeChecker.assert("(string->string) | string->(string[]) | void", args[2]?, token("HTTP->fetch"))
url = args.first.to_s
callback = args[1].as(Function)
options = args[2]?.nil? ? {} of ValueType => ValueType : args[2].as(Hash(ValueType, ValueType))
method = (options["method"]? || "get").to_s.downcase
headers = options["headers"]?
form = options["form"]?
TypeChecker.assert("string", method, token("HTTP->fetch"))
if headers.nil?
else
  TypeChecker.assert("string[][]", headers, token("HTTP->fetch"))
end
if form.nil?
else
  TypeChecker.assert("string | (string->any)", form, token("HTTP->fetch"))
end
headers_obj = HTTP::Headers.new
if headers.nil?
else
  headers = convert_headers(headers.as(Array))
  headers.each do |h|
    if h.size == 2
    else
      Logger.report_error("Invalid header array '#{h}'", "Header array must have exactly 2 elements. The first is the key, the second is the value.", token("HTTP->fetch"))
    end
    headers_obj.add(h.first, h.last)
  end
end
case method
when "put", "patch", "post"
  if form.nil?
    Logger.report_error("Invalid #{method.upcase} options", "Options for #{method.upcase} method must include a 'form' key", token("HTTP->fetch"))
  end
end
case method
when "get"
  res = HTTP::Client.get(url, headers_obj)
when "post"
  res = HTTP::Client.post(url, headers_obj, form.is_a?(Hash(String, String)) ? form.to_json : form.to_s)
when "put"
  res = HTTP::Client.put(url, headers_obj, form.is_a?(Hash(String, String)) ? form.to_json : form.to_s)
when "patch"
  res = HTTP::Client.patch(url, headers_obj, form.is_a?(Hash(String, String)) ? form.to_json : form.to_s)
when "delete"
  res = HTTP::Client.delete(url, headers_obj)
else
  Logger.report_error("Failed to fetch", "Invalid HTTP method '#{method}'", token("HTTP->fetch"))
end
wrapped_body = {} of String => IFunction
wrapped_body["json"] = Client::ResponseBody::ToJSON.new(@interpreter, res.body)
wrapped_body["text"] = Client::ResponseBody::ToText.new(@interpreter, res.body)
wrapped_res = {} of String => String | Int64 | Hash(String, IFunction)
wrapped_res["status_code"] = res.status_code
wrapped_res["body"] = wrapped_body
callback.call([TypeChecker.as_value_type(wrapped_res)])

def.name: call
def.body:
TypeChecker.assert("uint", args.first, token("HTTP::Server->listen"))
TypeChecker.assert("Function", args[1], token("HTTP::Server->listen"))
port = (args.first.as(Int)).to_i32
server = HTTP::Server.new do |ctx|
  ctx.response.content_type = "text/plain"
  wrapped_res = {} of String => Server::ContextFunctionBase
  wrapped_res["content_type"] = Response::SetContentType.new(@interpreter, ctx)
  wrapped_res["send"] = Response::Send.new(@interpreter, ctx)
  wrapped_req = {} of String => ValueType
  wrapped_req["path"] = ctx.request.path
  wrapped_req["query"] = ctx.request.query
  wrapped_req["parameter"] = Request::GetParameter.new(@interpreter, ctx)
  wrapped_req["remote_address"] = !ctx.request.remote_address.nil? ? ctx.request.remote_address.to_s : nil
  (args[1].as(Function)).call([TypeChecker.hash_as_value_type(wrapped_res), TypeChecker.hash_as_value_type(wrapped_req)])
end
server.listen(port)

def.name: call
def.body:
TypeChecker.assert("Range|float|int|void", args.first?, token("Math->random"))
if args.empty?
  rand
else
  if args.first.is_a?(Num)
    rand(args.first.as(Num))
  else
    r = args.first.as(Range)
    if r.begin.is_a?(Int)
      a = r.to_a.map(&.to_i)
      rand(a.first..a.last)
    else
      a = r.to_a.map(&.to_f)
      rand(a.first..a.last)
    end
  end
end

def.name: call
def.body:
TypeChecker.assert("uint", args.first, token("Socket::Server->listen"))
TypeChecker.assert("func", args[1], token("Socket::Server->listen"))
port = (args.first.as(Int)).to_i32
tcpserver = TCPServer.new("0.0.0.0", port)
while client = tcpserver.accept?
  wrapped_conn = {} of String => Server::ContextFunctionBase
  wrapped_conn["send"] = Server::Connection::Send.new(@interpreter, client)
  wrapped_conn["recv"] = Server::Connection::Receive.new(@interpreter, client)
  wrapped_conn["close"] = Server::Connection::Close.new(@interpreter, client)
  spawn do
    (args[1].as(Function)).call([TypeChecker.hash_as_value_type(wrapped_conn)])
  end
end
puts(port)

def.name: get_method
def.body:
case name.lexeme
when "combine"
  Combine.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "delete"
  Delete.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "delete_at"
  DeleteAt.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "reverse"
  Reverse.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "rindex"
  RIndex.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "index"
  Index.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "includes?"
  Includes.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "empty?"
  IsEmpty.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "sort"
  Sort.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "join"
  Join.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "push"
  Push.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "pop"
  Pop.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "shift"
  Shift.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "first"
  First.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "last"
  Last.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "first?"
  FirstNullable.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "last?"
  LastNullable.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "sum"
  Sum.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "filter"
  Filter.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "map"
  Map.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
else
  Logger.report_error("Invalid vector method or property", name.lexeme, name)
end

def.body:
webhook_url = args[0].to_s
payload = {"content" => args[1].to_s}
headers = HTTP::Headers {"Content-Type" => "application/json"}
response = HTTP::Client.post(url: webhook_url, form: payload, headers: headers, tls: true)
if response.status_code == 301
  new_location = response.headers["Location"]
  return call([new_location, args[1]])
else
  if response.status_code == 204
    return "Message sent successfully!"
  else
    Logger.report_error("Failed to send webhook message", "Status code #{response.status_code}", token("Webhook->send"))
  end
end

instance_methods.args_string: (error_type : String, message : String, line : UInt32, pos : UInt32, file_path : String) : Exception
instance_methods.args_html: (error_type : String, message : String, line : UInt32, pos : UInt32, file_path : String) : Exception

def.name: report_error
def.body:
first_frame = @@stack_trace.first?
popped_frames = @@stack_trace.pop(@@trace_level)
last_frame = @@stack_trace.last? || first_frame
if file_path == "intrinsic"
  full_message = ""
else
  source = last_frame.nil? ? (  @@sources[file_path]? || "") : last_frame.file_source
  if last_frame.nil?
  else
    file_path = last_frame.token.location.file_name
    line = last_frame.token.location.line
    pos = last_frame.token.location.position
  end
  full_message = Util::Color.faint("#{line - 1} |\n")
  full_message = full_message + "#{Util::Color.faint("#{line} | ")} #{Util::Color.bold((source.split('\n'))[line - 1]? || "")}\n"
  bottom_line = "#{line + 1} |"
  full_message = full_message + (Util::Color.faint(bottom_line))
  full_message = full_message + "#{(" " * (Math.max((pos.to_i + 1) - bottom_line.size, bottom_line.size))) + (Util::Color.light_yellow("^"))}\n"
end
full_message = full_message + (Util::Color.red("\n#{error_type}: #{message}"))
stack_dump = [] of String
first_trace_dump = "\n#{TAB}at #{File.basename(file_path)}:#{line}:#{pos}"
if @@stack_trace.empty?
  stack_dump << first_trace_dump
end
@@stack_trace.reverse.each do |tr|
  if (tr == @@stack_trace.last) && (tr.token.lexeme != "throw")
    stack_dump << first_trace_dump
  end
  stack_dump << "\n#{TAB}at #{tr.token.lexeme} (#{File.basename(tr.token.location.file_name)}:#{tr.token.location.line}:#{tr.token.location.position})"
end
if full_message.nil?
  full_message = ""
end
full_message = full_message + (Util::Color.red(stack_dump.join))
if @@debug
  raise(full_message)
else
  abort(full_message, 1)
end

def.name: parse
def.body:
start_time = Time.monotonic
hoister = TypeHoister.new(@tokens)
hoister.hoist_types
last_statement : Statement::Base | ::Nil = nil
statements = [] of Statement::Base
while !finished?
  statement = parse_statement
  if ((statement.is_a?(Statement::SingleExpression) && (statement.expression === LiteralExpression)) && last_statement.is_a?(Statement::SingleExpression)) && (last_statement.expression === LiteralExpression)
    Logger.report_error("Invalid expression", "Two literal expressions may not be adjacent to each other. Got '#{last_statement.token.lexeme}' and '#{statement.token.lexeme}'", statement.token)
  end
  statements << statement
  last_statement = statement
end
end_time = Time.monotonic
if @run_benchmarks
  puts("Parser @#{@file_path} took #{Util.get_elapsed(start_time, end_time)}.")
end

def.name: assert
def.body:
typedef = typedef.gsub(/\s+/, "")
matches = is?(typedef, value, token)
if matches
else
  if typedef.starts_with?("(")
    next_paren_idx = (typedef.index(")")) || typedef.size
    ungrouped_chars = typedef.lchop.chars
    ungrouped_chars.delete_at(next_paren_idx - 1, 1)
    ungrouped_type = ungrouped_chars.join
    assert(ungrouped_type, value, token)
  else
    if typedef.ends_with?("[]")
      value_type = typedef.rchop("[]")
      if value.is_a?(Array)
      else
        report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
      end
      (value.as(Array)).each do |v|
        assert(value_type, v, token)
      end
    else
      if (typedef.includes?("->")) && ((typedef.split("->", 2)).size == 2)
        types = typedef.split("->", 2)
        key_type = types.first.strip
        value_type = types.last.strip
        if value.is_a?(Hash)
        else
          report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
        end
        internal = hash_as_value_type(value)
        internal.each do |k, v|
          assert(key_type, k, token)
          assert(value_type, v, token)
        end
      else
        if typedef.includes?("|")
          types = typedef.split("|")
          types.each do |type|
            matches || (matches = is?(type.strip, value, token))
          end
          if matches
          else
            report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
          end
        else
          report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

def.name: cast?
def.body:
if is?(type.lexeme, "", type)
  if value.is_a?(ClassInstance)
    to_string = value.get_method("to_string", include_private: false, required: false)
    to_string.nil? ? value.name : to_string.call([] of ValueType)
  else
    value.to_s
  end
else
  if (type.lexeme.includes?("char")) && (value.to_s.size == 1)
    value.to_s.chars.first
  else
    if (type.lexeme.includes?("uint")) && ((    (((value.is_a?(String) || value.is_a?(Char)) || value.is_a?(Float)) || value.is_a?(Int)) || value.is_a?(UInt)
    value.is_a?(Bool)))
      if value.is_a?(Bool)
        value ? 1 : 0
      else
        value.to_u64
      end
    else
      if (is?(type.lexeme, 1, type)) && ((((value.is_a?(String) || value.is_a?(Char)) || value.is_a?(Float)) || value.is_a?(Int)) || value.is_a?(Bool))
        if value.is_a?(Bool)
          value ? 1 : 0
        else
          value.to_i
        end
      else
        if (is?(type.lexeme, 1.0, type)) && ((((value.is_a?(String) || value.is_a?(Char)) || value.is_a?(Float)) || value.is_a?(Int)) || value.is_a?(Bool))
          if value.is_a?(Bool)
            value ? 1.0 : 0.0
          else
            value.to_f
          end
        else
          if (is?(type.lexeme, true, type)) && (value.is_a?(Float) || value.is_a?(Int))
            if (value.to_i == 1) || (value.to_i == 0)
              value.to_i == 1
            end
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

    types = typedef.split("|")
    resolved = true
    types.each do |t|
      if get_registered_type?(t, token).nil?
        resolved = false
        break
      end
    end
    if resolved
      Type.new(typedef)
    end
  else
    if (typedef.includes?("->")) && ((typedef.split("->", 2)).size == 2)
      types = typedef.split("->", 2)
      key_type = types.first
      value_type = types.last
      if get_registered_type?(key_type, token).nil? && get_registered_type?(value_type, token).nil?
      else
        Type.new(typedef)
      end
    else
      if typedef.ends_with?("[]")
        value_type = typedef.rchop("[]")
        if get_registered_type?(value_type, token).nil?
        else
          Type.new(typedef)
        end
      else
        REGISTERED.find do |t|
          t.name == typedef
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: is?
instance_methods.args_string: (typedef : String, value : ValueType, token : Token, except = false) : Bool
instance_methods.args_html: (typedef : String, value : ValueType, token : Token, except = false) : Bool

def.name: is?
def.body:
typedef = typedef.gsub(/\s+/, "")
case typedef
when "Table"
  value.is_a?(Hash)
when "Vector"
  value.is_a?(Array)
when "Range"
  value.is_a?(Range)
when "Function"
  value.is_a?(Callable)
when "class"
  value.is_a?(Class)
when "type"
  value.is_a?(Type)
when "bigint"
  value.is_a?(Int)
when "uint"
  value.is_a?(Int) && value >= 0
when "int"
  value.is_a?(Int)
when "float"
  value.is_a?(Float)
when "bool"
  value.is_a?(Bool)
when "string"
  value.is_a?(String)
when "char"
  value.is_a?(Char)
when "none", "void"
  value == nil
when "any"
  true
else
  matches = false
  if typedef.starts_with?("(")
    next_paren_idx = (typedef.index(")")) || typedef.size
    ungrouped_chars = typedef.lchop.chars
    idx = next_paren_idx - 1
    ungrouped_chars.delete_at(idx, ungrouped_chars.size - idx)
    ungrouped_type = ungrouped_chars.join
    matches = is?(ungrouped_type, value, token)
  else
    if typedef.ends_with?("[]")
      value_type = typedef.rchop("[]")
      matches = value.is_a?(Array)
      if value.is_a?(Array)
        (value.as(Array)).each do |v|
          matches && (matches = is?(value_type, v, token))
        end
      end
    else
      if typedef.includes?("|")
        types = typedef.split("|")
        types.each do |type|
          matches || (matches = is?(type.strip, value, token, except: true))
        end
      else
        if (typedef.includes?("->")) && ((typedef.split("->", 2)).size == 2)
          types = typedef.split("->", 2)
          key_type = types.first.strip
          value_type = types.last.strip
          matches = value.is_a?(Hash)
          if value.is_a?(Hash)
            (value.as(Hash)).each do |k, v|
              matches && (matches = is?(key_type, k, token))
              matches && (matches = is?(value_type, v, token))
            end
          end
        else
          if typedef.ends_with?("?")
            non_nullable_type = typedef.rchop
            matches = is?(non_nullable_type + "|void", value, token)
          else
            if matches
            else
              registered = get_registered_type?(typedef, token)
              if registered.nil?
              else
                if ALIASES.has_key?(registered.name)
                  unaliased = ALIASES[registered.name]
                  matches = is?(unaliased, value, token)
                else
                  if value.is_a?(ClassInstance)
                    matches = value.name == registered.name
                  else
                    if except
                    else
                      Logger.report_error("Expected type #{registered.name}, got", get_mapped(value.class), token)
                    end
                  end
                end
              end
            end
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
  matches
end

types.name: Stringify
types.doc: This module is responsible for pretty-printing Cosmo values
types.summary: This module is responsible for pretty-printing Cosmo values

def.name: any_value
def.body:
if value.is_a?(Hash)
  hashmap(value, @@indent)
else
  if value.is_a?(Array(ValueType) | Spread)
    s = String::Builder.new
    if value.is_a?(Spread)
      s.write("*".to_slice)
    end
    s.write("[".to_slice)
    enumerable = value.is_a?(Spread) ? value.array : value
    multiline = enumerable.size >= 10
    if multiline
      push_indent(s)
    end
    enumerable.each_with_index do |v, i|
      if multiline
        s.write(('\n' + (TAB * @@indent)).to_slice)
      end
      s.write((any_value(v)).to_slice)
      if i == (enumerable.size - 1)
        if multiline
          s.write(('\n' + (TAB * (@@indent - 1))).to_slice)
        end
      else
        s.write(", ".to_slice)
      end
    end
    if multiline
      pop_indent
    end
    s.write("]".to_slice)
    s.to_s
  else
    if value.is_a?(ClassInstance)
      Util::Color.light_yellow(value.name)
    else
      if value.is_a?(String | Char)
        delim = value.is_a?(String) ? "\"" : "'"
        Util::Color.light_green((delim + value.to_s) + delim)
      else
        if value.is_a?(Num | Range(Int128 | Int64 | Int32 | Int16 | Int8 | UInt, Int128 | Int64 | Int32 | Int16 | Int8 | UInt))
          Util::Color.light_purple(value.to_s)
        else
          if value.is_a?(Bool)
            Util::Color.bold(Util::Color.light_cyan(value.to_s))
          else
            if value.nil?
              Util::Color.bold(Util::Color.red("none"))
            else
              value.to_s
            end
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

def.name: hashmap
def.body:
@@indent = base_indent
s = String::Builder.new("{{")
push_indent(s)
h.each_with_index do |entry, i|
  s.write((stringify_hash_entry(h, entry, i)).to_slice)
end
pop_indent
s.write("#{TAB * @@indent}}}".to_slice)
s.to_s
